Interfaith-RISE facilitates and supports the self-sufficiency and community integration of refugees and asylees from across the world through affordable housing, English language proficiency, and cultural orientation, and by providing access to social, mental health, and healthcare services in Central and Southern New Jersey. Interfaith-RISE draws strength and vision from its multi-cultural and multi-faith coalition that welcomes and promotes respect for refugees from diverse traditions and backgrounds. Interfaith-RISE is an official affiliate site of the US Committee for Refugees & Immigrants (USCRI).,
Are you a new refugee arrival?,
Please call 732-357-0590  or email info@interfaithrise.org   to find out if you are eligible for our services.,
info@interfaithrise.org ,(mailto:info@interfaithrise.org)
 ,
PLEASE NOTE:  We cannot see walk-ins on the same day.  An appointment will be made so the client can return at a future date.,
 ,
Are you and/or your organization interested in volunteering?  I-RISE Recycled Woodshop and Global Grace Farms now have SignUpGenius links for your convenience: ,
Woodshop:  Click on this link ,
Click on this link ,(https://www.signupgenius.com/go/10C0B44ABAA28A1F5CF8-50275351-irise#/)
GG Farm:  Click on this link ,
Click on this link ,(https://www.signupgenius.com/go/10C0A4DA8AA2BA7F4C52-50526760-global#/)
We are in dire need of school supplies. Click on this link to download a PDF to share with your community.,
Click on this link ,(https://interfaithrise.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/School-Supplies-Drive-PDF.pdf)
We are also still in need of flat-screen TV’s and especially, bicycles and cars. Bikes and cars are so essential to families reaching self-sufficiency by allowing them to get to work and not having to rely on expensive ride share companies.  Contact fida@interfaithrise.org (Highland Park) or ashley@interfaithrise.org (South Jersey) for more info.  We thank you for your continued generosity!,
fida@interfaithrise.org ,(mailto:fida@interfaithrise.org)
ashley@interfaithrise.org ,(mailto:ashley@interfaithrise.org)
 ,
You asked for a “Frequently Asked Questions Sheet” and we listened! At times when you, our dedicated volunteers and donors, share about I-RISE with your local community, you are met with questions, hesitations or resistance to the work we do. This sheet is intended to explain who we are, what we do, how refugees get connected with us, and much more. We hope this will help you better navigate conversations as you share info about I-RISE and encourage others to get involved with us!  Click on this link to download the document.,
Click on this link ,(https://interfaithrise.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/IRISE-FAQ-Sheet_FINAL.pdf)
,
These packets, which are available in English, Spanish and Haitian-Creole, are intended to support you and your family.  You will find information about resources and services including legal services, food and income assistance, health care and mental health services, school enrollment, getting a state identification card, and transportation. Click on the links for downloadable PDFs:,
Welcome Booklet – English,
Welcome Booklet – English ,(https://interfaithrise.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/Welcome-Booklet_ENGLISH_01.2024.pdf)

Welcome Booklet – Spanish,
Welcome Booklet – Spanish ,(https://interfaithrise.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/Welcome-Booklet_Espanol.pdf)

Do you use our building at 19 South 2nd Avenue in Highland Park on a regular basis?  Please read our Feedback Policy by clicking on this link for a downloadable copy to learn how you can submit comments and/or complaints through proper channels.,
this link ,(https://interfaithrise.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/Feedback-Policy-FINAL-10.26.23.pdf)
Interfaith-RISE is a program of the Reformed Church of Highland Park Affordable Housing corporation, a non-profit, 501(c)3 organization that provides affordable housing, supportive services, and connection to meaningful community to low-income individuals and families in central New Jersey. All RCHP-AHC projects are non-discriminatory and are open to the public. Learn more at rchp-ahc.org,
 rchp-ahc.org ,(http://rchp-ahc.org/)
info@interfaithrise.org ,(mailto:info@interfaithrise.org)
